TopicTitle: [request] see in editro whether a part is physicsless

Articles.Content: essentiallly, right now the only way to search for physicsless parts is to put them on something and see if the COM moves. that is tedious, the other way is to look at every individual .cfg file, even more tedious. would somone make a mod making a part show its physics status in the tooltip?

Not the solution you seek but there is a third way (although it could be out of date somewhat):

http://wiki.kerbalspaceprogram.com/wiki/Physicsless_part

Just out of curiosity what brings you the need for this information?

SM
You could do a "Search file contents" in your operating system for the PhysicsSignificance = X line.

@toric5 Neat idea and ModuleManager makes it possible! Create an empty .cfg file somewhere in GameData-folder and paste the following: 

@PART[*]:HAS[#PhysicsSignificance[1]]:FINAL{
	@description ^= :$: Physicless Part.
	@tags ^= :$: physicless
}

Adds a suffix to the part-description and makes it easy to view all physicless parts ingame (just search for physicless in the editor).
